block.p: Jill Astrid Simpson, the daughter of Joyce Shallis of Milford, Conn., and Allan Claude Simpson of Long Island City, Queens, is to be married today to Jonathan James Owens, the son of Caroline and James Rigueur Owens Jr. of Westport, Conn. The Rev. William Simpson, a United Methodist minister and an uncle of the bride, officiated at the Unitarian Church in Westport.

Mrs. Owens, 32, is an admissions coordinator for a New York University study abroad program. She graduated from St. Olaf College in Northfield, Minn. Her mother is a clinical social work supervisor at Bridges, a private mental health clinic in Milford, Conn. Her father, who retired as a music and art teacher at Norman Thomas High School in Manhattan, is a painter who last month was the artist in residence at the American Academy in Rome.

Jill Astrid Simpson, the daughter of Joyce Shallis of Milford, Conn., and Allan Claude Simpson of Long Island City, Queens, is to be married today to Jonathan James Owens, the son of Caroline and James Rigueur Owens Jr. of Westport, Conn. The Rev. William Simpson, a United Methodist minister and an uncle of the bride, officiated at the Unitarian Church in Westport.

Mrs. Owens, 32, is an admissions coordinator for a New York University study abroad program. She graduated from St. Olaf College in Northfield, Minn. Her mother is a clinical social work supervisor at Bridges, a private mental health clinic in Milford, Conn. Her father, who retired as a music and art teacher at Norman Thomas High School in Manhattan, is a painter who last month was the artist in residence at the American Academy in Rome.

Mr. Owens, 32, is a trumpet player who until last month was performing with Blood, Sweat and Tears and is now performing as a substitute musician in the orchestras of Broadway musicals. He is a graduate of the Eastman School of Music of the University of Rochester. His mother owns Newsletters Plus, a corporate communications business in Westport. His father retired as the chief executive of the Heritage Sportswear Company, which was the New York marketing arm for an India-based manufacturer of men's and women's clothing.
